iati-activity.title: Venture Trust Malawi:Moving on Malawi
iati-activity.description: This project will directly deliver on the commitments of the Co-operation Agreement around strengthening the context for human rights and in particular concerns around prisoners in Malawi. This project will seek to reduce reoffending rates by working with young men coming out of Kachere prison. They will work with them to help motivate them and provide the opportunity to move on and make positive changes to their life. One issue that young people face across prisons in Malawi is that they may be held there for over two years while they wait for their case to come to court, when the offence may actually have a much shorter tariff. The project will provide personal skills development in consequential thinking, HIV/AIDS awareness and positive goal setting by placing two Outreach and Development posts inside the prison. These posts will work to ensure that young prisoners can be referred to an appropriate support group in the area of their origin when they come for release or on being granted bail, to continue their skills development and ensure they are positively engaged in their community through education and training opportunities.
